Description: Rim and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery plate; cream slip on interior; Stopt maeander frieze on rim; on floor, band with added red and white lines; animal frieze to left: rear of goat on left, protome of a horse with reins and bit in centre, head of goat on right; part of band below. on outer face of lip oblique lines; exterior: three bands at rim, two on mid-wall. Two suspension holes in the rim, as well as two repair holes.
Curator's comments: The suspension holes were drilled after the decoration was applied but before firing.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.242, no.4)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 9)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 53)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.750)
